tool_description: Fetch and return the HTML content of a given URL using a real browser and rotating proxies. Big IP pool + automatic rotation.
name: 🔴 Page Scraper 🔴 Daddy
title: 🔴 Page Scraper 🔴 Daddy

api_list.name: screenshot
api_list.description:
This endpoint allows you to capture a screenshot of a webpage. The user sends a URL in the request body, and the API navigates to that URL, waits for the page to load, and then captures a screenshot. The screenshot is then returned as a PNG image in the response.

This endpoint uses a real browser to navigate to the specified URL, waits for the page to load, and then captures a screenshot. The screenshot is then returned as a PNG image in the response. This method may take longer due to the time required to launch the browser and load the page.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://page-scraper-daddy.p.rapidapi.com/screenshot"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "page-scraper-daddy.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: fetch-simple
api_list.description: This endpoint fetches content from the specified URL using a simple HTTP GET request. It's faster than the /fetch endpoint as it doesn't require launching a browser, making it ideal for fetching static HTML or JSON data. The endpoint uses rotating proxies for increased anonymity.
api_list.code:

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: fetch
api_list.description: This endpoint uses a real browser to navigate to the specified URL, waits for the page to load, and fetches the HTML content of the page. It's designed for dynamic webpages that rely on JavaScript to load content. This method may take longer due to the time required to launch the browser and load the page, but it ensures a more accurate representation of what a real user would see in their browser.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://page-scraper-daddy.p.rapidapi.com/fetch"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "page-scraper-daddy.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
